messages.content: I am proud to have lived in the heart of our constituency for over 40 years.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Speaks up for local jobs and against policies of other parties that would put them at risk.
Wants to keep up both Tories and Liberal Democrats attacks on NHS and policing, criticizes Lib Dem plans to form a Tory government if there is a hung Parliament.
Campaigns for changes in lifestyle and legally binding cuts in emissions, huge investments in energy conservation, renewables and sustainable transport, and decent housing for all.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Neither the Conservative nor the Liberal Democrat candidate lives in Oxford East.
mentions.tacticalSituation: Lib Dems plan to form a Tory government if there is a hung Parliament.

issues.environment: I believe climate change demands changes in lifestyle as well as the legally binding cuts in emissions I have campaigned and voted for.
issues.governance: Lib Dems have refused to rule out the cuts to what they call 'the sacred cow of the NHS'.
issues.health: Calls to preserve Labour achievements like the winter allowance, child benefits, the Sure Start Children's Centres. Criticizes potential cuts to NHS and Child Trust funds.
issues.immigration: Mentions responding to constituents' concerns, including many refugees and asylum seekers who have come for help.

housing.content: Wants to see huge investments in energy conservation, renewables and sustainable transport to make a reality of a green new deal. This must go hand in hand with the drive against world poverty and injustice.

politicalExperience.achievements: Lived in the heart of the constituency for over 40 years

contactInformation.address: Unit A, Bishops Mews Transport Way Oxford OX4 6HD

leaflet.additionalNotes: Mentions writing more than 20,000 letters a year addressing constituents' concerns and a willingness to respond to refugees and asylum seekers.
